metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9705 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the enchant_broker_request_dict function inext/enchant/enchant.c in PHP before 5.4.38, 5.5.x before 5.5.22, and 5.6.xbefore 5.6.6 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via vectorsthat trigger creation of multiple dictionaries.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9705` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
libapache2-mod-php5filter - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
libphp5-embed - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
php-pear - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
php5-cgi - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
php5-cli - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
php5-common - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
php5-curl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
php5-enchant - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
php5-fpm - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
php5-gd - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
php5-gmp - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
php5-intl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
php5-ldap - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
php5-mysql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
php5-mysqlnd - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
php5-odbc - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
php5-pgsql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
php5-pspell - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
php5-readline - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
php5-recode - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
php5-snmp - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
php5-sqlite - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
php5-sybase - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
php5-tidy - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
php5-xmlrpc - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
php5-xsl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: php5 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.7').
